elements.title: Basis of Presentation and Non-GAAP Financial Measures

data.value: This MD&A includes financial information for the 3-month periods ended December 31, 2022 (Q4 2022) and December 31, 2021 (Q4 2021), respectively, and Fiscal 2022 and Fiscal 2021.
KPLP believes that this measure provides useful information to management of KPLP and the readers of the financial information in measuring the financial performance and financial condition of KPLP.
Kruger Products is committed to building its consumer brands and developing innovative products.
KPLP generates revenue on the sale of branded, private label and AFH tissue products in Canada and the United States.
Branded tissue products like Cashmere, Purex, Scotties, SpongeTowels, Bonterra, White Cloud
Regions include Canada and the U.S.
Foreign exchange swaps and forward contracts
Includes fixed and variable costs, freight, warehousing, and handling costs
Fibre, labour, and energy costs, representing 50-80% of total cost
Ability to pass cost increases to customers may be affected by market conditions
Plant maintenance, overhead, insurance, property taxes, IT, depreciation, and amortization
Sales volume, geographical mix, fuel costs, North American supply and demand
Marketing, selling, general and administrative costs, including small depreciation
Includes costs from credit facilities, deferred financing fees, lease liabilities, pension costs
Includes foreign exchange gains/losses and changes in fair value of derivatives

data.value: (C$ millions, unless otherwise noted) - Fiscal 2022: -8.1 / Fiscal 2021: 6.1

Segment operating income is the earnings (loss) for each such segment before interest expense and other finance costs, income taxes, depreciation, amortization, impairment (gain on sale) of non-financial assets, loss (gain) on disposal of property, plant and equipment, foreign exchange loss (gain), costs related to restructuring activities, changes in amortized cost of Partnership units liability, change in fair value of derivatives, consulting costs related to operational transformation initiatives, corporate development related costs and loss (gain) on sale of shares.
Consumer segment revenue was $1,394.1 million in Fiscal 2022 compared to $1,260.1 million in Fiscal 2021, an increase of $134.0 million or 10.6%.
AFH segment revenue was $287.3 million in Fiscal 2022 compared to $205.1 million in Fiscal 2021, an increase of $82.2 million or 40.1%.
The table shows segment revenue and adjusted EBITDA for fiscal years 2020-2022. Revenue shows growth in 2022, with total segment revenue increasing by 14.8% to $1,681.4 million.
